page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY - CHERINGTON
page.content: 1985 sees the Bicentenary of the publication of Ralph Bigland's "Historical, Monumental and Genealogical Collections Relating to the County of Gloucester" in which he recorded all tombstone inscriptions then extant for the church of St. Nicholas at Cherington. We have been back to see what survives today. Inside the church itself there were 16 monuments recorded. Of these 9 can now be positively identified, whilst 7 cannot be traced. Curiously 5 exist today which pre-date Bigalnd, yet are unrecorded by him. Possibly altered furniture or the removal of pews may have brought these to light. In the churchyard Bigland lists some 15 tombs. Due to two centuries of weathering these Cotswold stone monuments have become largely illegible, only 1 can be identified.
